content:
Congrats on the 5.0 release @Tim Abbott and team! Looking at settings for web-public streams (screenshot below), the "Allow creating" checkbox is disabled (i.e., I cannot turn the feature on). It would be great to try this feature as a way to offer a better user experience than https://chat-archive.fhir.org. Is there a setting in the hosting config that needs to be flipped for us, or am I misunderstanding the instructions at https://zulip.com/help/web-public-streams#enable-or-disable-web-public-streams ?

image.png
@Josh Mandel yeah, we're currently doing it opt-in for Zulip Cloud; just email support@zulip.com with a request and it'll get enabled for you.

saw that josh made the #smart stream web-public...pretty cool. couple questions:

  1. I assume only admins can do that?
  2. Will that make the streams indexable by google? ...I feel like that could be a game-changer

Here's the detailed documentation for web-public streams: https://zulip.com/help/web-public-streams

  1. There is an organization setting for who can make streams web-public, but:

Only users in trusted roles (moderators and administrators) can be given permission to create web-public streams. This is intended to make it hard for an attacker to host malicious content in an unadvertised web-public stream in a legitimate organization.

  1. From the help page:

Web-public streams do not yet support search engine indexing. You can use zulip-archive to create an archive of a Zulip organization that can be indexed by search engines.

We would like to add a search indexing option in the future, but it will be a significant engineering project to do so.

In theory today FHIR's public streams can be indexed by Google based on https://chat-archive.fhir.org -- but the Google crawler has not actually indexed this domain despite the domain's being registered with the Google search console for about a month. I have not debugged this. Also there are some issues with topic names that include check marks that I have not invested the time to fix because web public streams are a much nicer solution ;-))

@Alya Abbott I noticed that the current beta still requires users to click a pseudo-login button when viewing a web public stream. Is the plan to remove this step once the beta has reached some level of maturity?
Ah, we hadn't been planning on removing the login page step, but that's a great idea! I filed https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/21690, and I expect we'll address it before the public launch.
